text: The NCAA softball championship was the softball tournament of the National Collegiate Athletic Association in the Philippines. The tournament was discontinued in 1986. ==Champions== {| class="wikitable" style="font- size:85%;" ! width=10%|Academic Year || width=45%|Juniors' || width=45%|Seniors' |- | 1965-66 || (1) || (1) |- | 1966-67 || (1) || (1) |- | 1967-68 || (2) || (1) |- | 1968-69 || (2) || (2) |- | 1969-70 || (1) || (3) |- | 1970-71 || (1) || (2) |- | 1971-72 || (2) || (3) and (4) |- | 1972-73 || (3) || (5) |- | 1973-74 || (4) || (6) |- | 1974-75 || (5) || (1) |- | 1975-76 || (2) || (7) |- | 1976-77 || (1) || (2) |- | 1977-78 || (2) || (3) |- | 1979-80 || (1) || (1) |- | 1980-81 || (6) || (8) |- | 1981-82 || (2) || (9) |- | 1982-83 || None || (10) |- | 1983-84 ||colspan=2 align=center| No tournament |- | 1984-85 ||colspan=2 align=center| No tournament |- | 1985-86 || None || (11) |- | After 1986 ||colspan=2 align=center| Discontinued |} ==Number of championships by school== {| class="wikitable" |-align=center !School !Jrs !Srs !All |- |'''''' |2 |11 |13 |- |'''''' |8 |3 |11 |- |'* |6 |0 |6 |- |'''''' |2 |3 |5 |- |'''''' |2 |1 |3 |- |' |2 |0 |2 |- |'''''' |0 |1 |1 |- |} NOTE * LSGH won its six (6) championships under DLSU. title: NCAA Softball Championship (Philippines)
